borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The bulk, mass, scale and sitting of the proposed development would result in an increased sense of overbearing and a harmful loss of outlook and daylight to neighbouring occupiers, particularly no.78 Temple Avenue. The proposal directly impacts the outlook to the first floor window on the south side elevation. The proposed first floor side extension is off-set just 80cm from this window.  The outlook from this window is significantly restricted. The proposed first floor rear extension poses a material impact upon the amenity of no.78 Temple Avenue therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The bulk, mass, scale and sitting of the proposed first floor side and rear extension would disrupt the openness of the built form of Temple Avenue. The proposal introduces a significant mass and bulk at first floor level to the side and rear of the dwelling which is considered to be insubordinate to the original dwelling and the terrace row.  The proposal does not align and sympathise with the symmetry of the terrace. Officers consider the proposal to be a sizeable addition to the dwelling resulting in the dwelling seeming disproportionately larger than the other dwellings in the terrace row, generating incongruity and an imbalance in the terrace. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Construction of a first floor side and rear extension.
